message.content:
We begin by examining what is given about Amanda and about Adam. The only statement involving Amanda is:

• “Amanda is Katherine's descendant.”

That is all that is stated about Amanda.

The only statement involving Adam is:

• “Adam is Emma's ancestor.”

So Amanda’s “lineage chain” comes from Katherine (and whatever is above Katherine) and Adam’s chain comes from his descendants (Emma, then further down). There is no statement that directly or indirectly connects Katherine’s line of descent with that of Emma (or any other person in Adam’s chain).

Because we see no overlap or connection between these two independent family chains, neither is Amanda an ancestor or descendant of Adam and there is no shared common descendant stated.

Even though in an extended family every person may eventually share some very distant ancestor, in the context of these given relationships (which appear as separate and unlinked branches) none of the specific relationships listed (common ancestor, common descendant, or one being the ancestor or descendant of the other) can be established from the provided information.

Thus, the correct answer is:

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
